metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1060 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
python before versions 2.7.15, 3.4.9, 3.5.6rc1, 3.6.5rc1 and 3.7.0 is vulnerable to catastrophic backtracking in pop3lib's apop() method. An attacker could use this flaw to cause denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1060` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.5
libpython2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.5
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.5
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.5
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.5
python2.7 - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.5
python2.7-examples - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.5
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.6-8ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

idle-python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7
libpython3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7
libpython3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7
libpython3.4-stdlib - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7
libpython3.4-testsuite - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7
python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7
python3.4-examples - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7
python3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7
python3.4-venv - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.6-8ubuntu0.5').
python3.4 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7').
python3.5 package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
